--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0210 b) Date of Occurrence: 16/01/2023
c) Installation Details: Vulture Heavy - AC-5613-495 at
Regional Depot-C
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 23/01/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Turbine Assembly d) Main Assembly: Station-2 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Turbine Assembly Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PR-8170-N6 h) Sl No.: SN-1983-196
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 21/11/2022 l) Date of Removal: 20/01/2023
Pg No: 49 Ln No: 11 Pg No: 85 Ln No: 12
m) Manufacturing Agency: Skyward Defense Systems n) Date, Month & Year July 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3093 Hrs / 110 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Starter generator malfunction. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Turbine Assembly component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Conduct fleet-wide inspection campaign
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 08/02/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 09/02/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 10/02/2023 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 14/02/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 16/02/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
